description: From Middle English replenisshen, borrowed from Old French repleniss-, stem of some of the conjugated forms of replenir, from re- + plenir, from plein, from Latin plenus.

verbs.description: replenish (third-person singular simple present replenishes, present participle replenishing, simple past and past participle replenished)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To refill; to renew; to supply again or to add a fresh quantity to.
examples: It's a popular product, and they have to replenish their stock of it frequently.

entries.meaning: (transitive, archaic) To fill up; to complete; to supply fully.
(transitive, obsolete) To finish; to complete; to perfect.
